meanings.definition: The quality or state of being turgid or swollen.
meanings.sent1: The turgencies of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent2: The turgencies of the river after the heavy rain caused flooding.
meanings.sent3: The turgencies of the overfilled water balloon led to a comical explosion.
meanings.sent4: The turgencies of emotions in the room were palpable.
meanings.sent5: The turgencies of the ripe fruit made it irresistible to touch.

meanings.definition: The state of being urgent or pressing.
meanings.sent1: The turgencies of the situation required immediate action.
meanings.sent2: The turgencies of the deadline made everyone work faster.
meanings.sent3: The turgencies of the cat wanting food were amusingly demanding.
meanings.sent4: The turgencies of time seemed to speed up as the project deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The turgencies of the fire alarm made everyone evacuate quickly.
